ratings.comment: Professor Anderson is amazing. She challenges students to be better in a really thoughtful way. The activities and assignments are geared towards practical tasks of real life, things that we may end up doing in the future with any job. Shes extremely intelligent. I cannot speak more highly of this class.

Professor Anderson puts a lot of work into designing lessons, and it made this one of the most useful courses Ive taken. She connects students with each other in new ways that really make us feel connected, like art! I honestly felt cared for as a student.

She was extremely open-minded and sensitive about students who come from different backgrounds. Her enthusiasm was infectious and I learned as much from other students as from Dr. Anderson because everyone participated.

Dr. Anderson is a really interesting professor. One of the best I've had. And she really cares about students. She remembers everyone's name and she contacted me when I was falling behind. That meant a lot because it made me work and I ended up getting a good grade.

Dr. Anderson encouraged the class to do well academically, but it was clear that she also cares about us as people. So much of the class content is applicable to our own lives, and this class helped me connect some of my own anxiety with social structures. This class helped me know how to be a better citizen and happier at the same time.

Kate is really enthusiastic about environmental sociology and it is contagious. She did a really good job making us see how we can apply sociology in our careers and why its important. I've never thought about things from this perspective and it really made an impact on me.

Dr. Anderson is a good teacher. She made everyone feel comfortable and her lectures were interesting. You have to work, but if you keep up with the readings and reflections then it's not hard to get a good grade. This is the second class I've taken with her and I'd take another one.
Kate is great! You will love this class. The material is so important and Kate's lectures are clear, with good slides and videos. She's the best professor I've had at UW.
Dr. Anderson was almost intimidating in how much she knows, but she's so caring and she made it so that everyone in class participated a lot.
This class really changed how I see the world. I took it to fulfill a requirement and didn't expect to like it that much, but it turned out to be one of my favorite classes.

Cool guest speakers. Cool class activities. Lots of discussion. This is my second class with Prof Anderson. CES140 was pretty good and really eye-opening, but that was her first class and she's gotten a lot better at organization and assigning the right amount of reading.

Kate actually celebrates diversity and promotes inclusion, where most profs just write that on the syllabus and end up catering to the mostly white Wisconsin students. We read readings from all kinds of different authors and had really good debates. I think all the students learned a lot.

Ms. Anderson made sure to promote classroom based discussion of material and be inclusive of students. Very respectful of students and differences. I have applied knowledge gained in this course across multiple facets of my life.

Professor Kate Anderson did a great job engaging the students and promoting active learning. She is very intelligent, which can make it intimidating to participate in class, however, her friendly demeanor creates a comfortable learning environment. One of the most interesting, and applicable courses for anyone interested in environmental injustices

I really enjoyed taking this class, I have learned so much and I really value the knowledge and perspectives I have gained about America and its society. No matter how well I do in my classes here my grades will only be transfered as a pass, so I started of only desiring a C in each class but the class and the content were so interesting that I r

Prof. Anderson is dope. This was the best class I've had. It really opened my eyes to so much I'd never thought about before. It made me decide to major in sociology and minor in environmental studies.

Class completely misses the point it tries to make with environmental justice and intersectionality. Teacher often comes off as offensive, often subtly but sometimes outright with extremely negative language. Would not recommend this class for anyone looking to learn about environmental issues as they pertain to those outside of the middle-class.

Awesome class if you're interested in the intersection of sociology and the environment. Lots of readings but class discussions are always interesting. Covers a wide variety of topics, and Kate is a great professor!

I took this class because I needed to be full time. It was a Forest & Wildlife Ecology Sociology class. The discussions in class were fine, but the readings/homework were excessive for the level class it is and to make matters worse, there wasn't even a rubric that we were being graded from. The grades were completely arbitrary.
